body.p:
Dec 15th 1860
G. W. Johnson Esqr.
Dear Sir

I wrote you some weeks since reguesting you to remit me some money to pay for you deadening. As I have received no response I take it for granted you did not receive it. I have sent to Judge Breckenridge of St. Louis a check on you for $100 which you will please pay as I have already at great inconvenience adressed for you. I have had deadened of your land about 280 acres & stopped. So soon as I the land I will draw on your for the ballance. If you will remit me the Amt of your taxes I will take pleasur in paying them for you. Your friend truly
